definitions.structures.abstr.algebra.rings

Interface SemiRing

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Monoid, SemiGroup, XmlPrintable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Algebra, CommutativeRing, DiscreetDomain, DiscreetField, DiscreetRing, DiscreetSemiRing, Domain, EuclideanAlgebra, Field, FiniteCommutativeRing, FiniteDomain, FiniteField, FinitePrimeField, FiniteRing, IntegralDomain, PrimeField, Ring
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComplexPlane, Naturals, QuaternionSpace, RealLine

    public interface SemiRing
extends Monoid
    Author:
    ro A semi ring is a monoid (M,+), that can be restricted to a Monoid (M\{0}, * ) and where we find distributive laws are being respected

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

      default Element addition(Element first, Element second)
      addition in a semi ring is provided by the native operation of the semi ring as monoid.

        second - second element
        Returns:
